roleset.name: art, the action of illustrating/making pictures with a writing implement
roleset.note: DRAW-V NOTES: Frames file for 'draw' based on sentences in financial subcorpus and comparison with Chris' old frames file. I can't believe it's taken me this long to redo this verb. (from draw.01-v predicate notes)
DRAWING-N NOTES: Corresponds to VNcls performance-26.7-2-1, scribble-25.2. (from drawing.02-n)

example.name: draw-v: transitive
example.text: The only way you-1 can make it a big deal is *trace*-1 to draw linkages that just don't make sense.''
example.arg: linkages that just don't make sense

example.name: draw-v: with benefactive
example.text: John drew a picture of a rose for Mary.

example.name: do_drawing-l
example.text: Instead she asked for soaked biscuits and did drawings in the room after finishing .

roleset.name: pull, extract, withdraw
roleset.note: DRAW-V NOTES: "draw down" seems to be a specific financial usage; I'm not sure whatthe exact meaning is. (from draw.02-v)
DRAWING-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to 'draw.02' Vn class remove-10.1 and split-23.2. Framed by Katie. (from drawing.01-n)
DRAW-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Comparison to draw.02-v. VN class remove-10.1 and split-23.2. Framed by Katie. (from draw.01-n)
DRAW_DOWN-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on more-nouns. No VNcls. (from draw.02-n)

example.name: draw-v: all args
example.text: The dollar drew strength from the stock market's climb.

example.name: draw-v: passive
example.text: [An index]-1 of economic activity drawn *trace*-1 from the survey...

example.name: draw-v: ergative, with direction
example.text: As the London trading session drew to a close...

example.name: draw-v: transitive with odd directional
example.text: DEC ``drew down its European backlog'' and had flat world-wide orders overall.

example.name: draw-v: Medical
example.text: Dr. Betsy drew blood from the malaria patient.

example.name: drawing-n: metaphorical pull
example.text: his taking of the Fifth may permit the drawing of an adverse inference against him in the civil matter
example.arg: of an adverse inference against him

example.name: draw-n: Pull attention
example.text: the draw for the World Cup gets everybody excited

example.name: draw-n: more than arg 0 may be rare
draw-n: one more with just arg 0
example.text: Or are you an unreformed navel-gazer, unable to resist the draw of the Museum of Shoulda Woulda Coulda?
example.arg: of the Museum of Shoulda Woulda Coulda?

example.name: draw-n: corpus example
example.text: and I think it 's entirely uh probable that we will see a significant draw - down of American forces over the next uh next year /.

roleset.name: brandish a weapon
roleset.note: DRAW-V NOTES: Note that this sentence can also be the 'art' sense, as seen by theaddition of an instrument: John drew a knife on Mary with a purplemarker. (from draw.05-v)

example.name: draw-v: iolent tendencies
example.text: John drew a knife on Mary.

roleset.name: art: compose
roleset.note: DRAW_UP-V NOTES: Except for the particle, identical to the "art" sense of "draw". (from draw.03-v)

example.name: draw-up-v: transitive
example.text: Mr. Freeman said [machinists' union advisers]-1 plan *trace*-1 to meet this week *trace*-1 to try *trace*-1 to draw up a blueprint for some form of recapitalization that could include a special dividend for shareholders, an employee stake and, perhaps, an equity investment by a friendly investor.
example.arg: a blueprint for some form of recapitalization that could include a special dividend for shareholders, an employee stake and, perhaps, an equity investment by a friendly investor

example.name: draw-up-v: always 'alongside'?
example.text: John drew up alongside Mary in his customized hot-rod. And she laughed in his face.
